children.subject: Hi Shreyansh, the lectures are mandatory and won't be recorded/uploaded as the course requires in-person participation. Unfortunately at this time, we won't be able to accommodate students from different timezones but hope to continue the DeCal for next semester (in-person fingers crossed!).
Thanks for the quick Response! I have just applied for the course, When can we expect to hear back about enrollment confirmation and the CCN for the course?

We'll have the first lecture (9/10) open to everyone who has applied. Based on the attendance that day and the application, we'll select a group of students for the class and send the CCN the following day (9/11).

Is it compulsory to attend the Lectures live as some of us might be in weird timezones?

Will lectures be recorded and uploaded?

history.content:
Hello everyone!

 

My name is Alex Kwon, and I am leading the Introduction to Quantitative Finance DeCal with Annie Ouyang this upcoming Fall. We lead the quantitative strategies part of Capital Investments at Berkeley. If you are pursuing CS, Math, Stats, DS, Econ, IEOR, etc and are interested in the intersection of Finance and Technology, check us out!

 

Here is a description of the class:

 

The course will start by introducing the fundamentals of the Capital Markets, including Market Microstructure and Securities Pricing. Then, we will look at basic data processing skills to scrape, extract, and process open data from the web to build predictive models using modern Machine Learning techniques. We will tie the course together by introducing basic portfolio optimization and the popular methods used by various quantitative firms. Finally, we will test the student’s understanding of the material by having each student build their own trading strategy from selected tickers, analyze, and present the results.

 

We look forward to having you join us!

 

Link to DeCal: https://decal.berkeley.edu/courses/5266

Link to Application: https://forms.gle/h4qctRbWAvc6Yb6n9

Link to Course Website: https://stat198.org/
history.subject: Introduction to Quantitative Finance DeCal
